revised_title: Anatomical Observations and Theories on Nutritious Juice and Respiration
tldr: The author discusses various anatomical observations and theories related to the transmission of nutritious juice and the role of respiration in the body. Key points include the role of concave fibers in transmitting alimentary juice, the distinction between nutritive juice and blood, and the primary use of respiration being for the ventilation of the vital flame in the heart or blood.
